Divyanshu Kumar Singh
PublicationsCV

Hi! I am Divyanshu 👋.
Pronouns: he/him.

I'm a recent computer science graduate from IIIT Delhi. I am an ethnographer and critical computing scholar working in Human-Computer Interaction. Also, I code for most of the week as a full-time software engineer.

I am broadly interested in Identity, Communities, Marginality, Social Justice and Infrastructure. I work on a broad range of research projects and use ethnographic methods in my studies.

During my B.Tech at IIIT Delhi, I was (am still) fortunate to work with Dr. Jainendra Shukla, Dr. Venkata Ratnadeep Suri and Dr. Puspendra Singh. I was part of Human-Machine Interaction Lab and Mèlange Lab.


contact me

Email is best. You can reach me at divyanshu17048 at iiitd dot ac dot in. I also tweet almost all the time.

news

November 2021
Our work lead by Asra Sakeen Wani titled “Hartal (Strike) Happens Here Everyday”: Understanding Impact of Disruption on Education in Kashmir , got conditionally accepted at ACM CHI 2022.
June 2021
Honored to earn a Microsoft Research PhD Fellowship!
March 2021
Spoke at the Digital Life Initiative at Cornell Tech.
January 2021
Winter 2021: I am Teaching Assistant for DES101: Introduction to Human-Computer Interaction being instucted by Dr. Rajiv Ratn Shah
December 2020
Presented first phase of my Bachelor's Thesis - 'Design for the Well-Being of LGBTQIA+ University Students'. Slides.
October 2020
Selected for SIGCHI CSCW Asia Winter School (Dec 18-19), Taipei, Taiwan. I will be presenting my work on "Design for the Well-Being of LGBTQIA+ University Students".
Febuary 2020
Selected as a Student Volunteer at ACM/IEEE HRI'2020. Super excited to attend HRI at Cambridge (Yayy!) - Tickets Done, Visa Applied. :)
January 2020
Our work titled "Toy, Tutor, Peer or Pet: Preliminary Findings from Child-Robot Interaction in a Community School" has been Accepted as a Late Breaking Report at ACM/IEEE HRI'2020. (My first acceptance, after a rejection! xD )
